text: Ove Lind Ove Lind (June 29, 1926, Stockholm - April 16, 1991, Stockholm) was a Swedish jazz clarinetist. Lind first played professionally with Simon Brehm and Thore Swanerud in 1949. He was a member of the Swinging Swedes in 1952-1954, then cofounded a group with Gunnar Almstedt in 1954 which featured Bengt Hallberg and toured as Alice Babs's band. He released many albums in the 1960s and 1970s which showed the influence of Benny Goodman, and played with Teddy Wilson in 1970. In addition to his work in jazz, Lind also accompanied popular Swedish musicians, especially in the late 1950s and early 1960s. ==References== *Erik Kjellberg, "Ove Lind". The New Grove Dictionary of Jazz. 2nd edition, ed. Barry Kernfeld. Category:Swedish jazz clarinetists Category:Musicians from Stockholm Category:1926 births Category:1991 deaths
title: Ove Lind
